Articles.Content:
While  browsing CKAN this morning, I noticed that there are 791 mods listed as incompatible with version 1.13.  I realize some of these still work with 1.13, like my personal favorite, Impossible Innovations, but there are many mods that, for lack of a better term, have been abandoned.

What are your favorite mods that you wish would come back from the dead?

MM

I don't have any.

All the mods that I used to use are either still available, still being developed/supported, or have been superceded by better alternatives.

Are you sure all of them are dead, or it's just hard updating them?

Well, I do know for a fact that Better Atmospheres is dead

I want Kopernicus Expansions to come from the dead, because it has footprints! It hasn't been updated for any 1.1 version.

Edited August 7, 2016 by LaytheDragon
Adjustable Landing Gear was always surprisingly satisfying to use, but it's not looking like it's getting updated any time soon with wheel changes and such.

1 hour ago, GluttonyReaper said:

Adjustable Landing Gear was always surprisingly satisfying to use, but it's not looking like it's getting updated any time soon with wheel changes and such.   

It's on hold until the wheel changes stabilize, hopefully 1.2. There's not much point updating it at the moment when it's likely substantial changes will come then.

Here's a small list of things no longer supported, and whose developer hasn't green-lighted any ppl to take over (so we're screwed, really)

  • Kommit Nucleonics (Some very cool Nuke engines), was updated once for 0.24 I think, but models and stats where changed and I just kept the previous version.  No updates since.
  • Kosmos (some large solar panels, like the Balka, who where really awesome in KSP 0.23), no update since.
  • Science Alert (No news as of 1.0.4, just bumped the thread about it myself)
  • "IonHybElec_Pack" -- Had some extremely nice hybrid ion engines (Xe + LFO).  Not updated since like 0.22

I managed to self-fix most of them at tremendous cost of my own time last February.
Sadly, because of my opening line above I am not even allowed to release the fixed mods (It's pure crap if you ask me, but the rules have to be obeyed. It's quite frustrating).
I cannot fix the Science_Alert mod tho unfortunately.
